msContents.summary: Letter from Hatres to his brother Heras, telling him to send and fetch a certain fuller if he required the latter's services. (Grenfell & Hunt)

msItemStruct.note: Text is written on both sides: the main text is 8 lines written with the fibers. On the opposite side, there is one line written with the fibers, perpendicular to the text on the main side. Top, bottom, and left margins are intact; right margin is visible.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 13.9 x 8.2cm. This papyrus is in good condition, with only minor vertical tears.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1896-7) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1904, Dr. Parrish Collection).

div.ab: Hatres to Heras his brother, greeting. In accordance with your instructions concerning Serenus the fuller who is working with Phileas, if you have need of him send a servant for him today, the 19th. Do not neglect this, as I am keeping him. I pray for your health and prosperity. (Addressed) Deliver to Heras. (Grenfell & Hunt)
